title: Client Report - [What’s in a name?]
text:
The approach you take to load in your data depends on the type of file its contained within. The method below is a automated and organized way of loading your data. It helps you identify and fix errors in a more proper manner. The format of the ‘year’ column was not recognize a date, so that had to be changed.


Read and format project data
# Include and execute your code here
df = pd.read_csv("https://github.com/byuidatascience/data4names/raw/master/data-raw/names_year/names_year.csv")

df['year'] = pd.to_datetime(df["year"], format="%Y")

title: Client Report - [What’s in a name?]
text:
The approach you take to load in your data depends on the type of file its contained within. The method below is a automated and organized way of loading your data. It helps you identify and fix errors in a more proper manner. The format of the ‘year’ column was not recognize a date, so that had to be changed.


Read and format project data
# Include and execute your code here
df = pd.read_csv("https://github.com/byuidatascience/data4names/raw/master/data-raw/names_year/names_year.csv")

df['year'] = pd.to_datetime(df["year"], format="%Y")

title: Client Report - [What’s in a name?]
text:
QUESTION|TASK 1
How does your name at your birth year compare to its use historically?
The usage of the name Ana was quite popular in the year 1999. My birth year is definetly amongst the three most popular years of its usage. This could definitely explain why I have several cousins whose name is also Ana. The popularity of the name is prominent for about 20 years straight.


Show the code
Ana = df.query("name == 'Ana'")

Ana_chart = px.line(Ana, x='year', y='Total', title='Ana Through Time')

Ana_chart.add_vline(x='1999', line_dash="dash", line_color="orange")

Ana_chart.update_layout(xaxis_title='Year', yaxis_title='Total Count')

Ana_chart.show()

title: Client Report - [What’s in a name?]
text:
QUESTION|TASK 2
If you talked to someone named Brittany on the phone, what is your guess of his or her age? What ages would you not guess?
If I was talking to a Brittany on the phone, I would guess her age was between 32 and 34 years old. More specifically, I would guess she is 34 years old. Since, the year 1990 is where the usage of the name is at its highest.


Show the code
Brittany = df.query("name == 'Brittany'")

Brittany_chart = px.bar(Brittany, x='year', y='Total', title='Brittany Through Time')

Brittany_chart.update_layout(xaxis_title='Year', yaxis_title='Total Count')

Brittany_chart.show()

title: Client Report - [What’s in a name?]
text:
QUESTION|TASK 3
Mary,Martha,Peter, and Paul are all Christian names. From 1920-2000, compare the name usage of each of the four names. What trends do you notice?
If we take a look at the graph, its quite clear that Mary is the most popular name within the timeframe. The most popular year for the name usage is 1950. In second place, for the most popular name,is Paul. The highest peak for the usage of that name is at about 1954. It is interesting to notice that after the name Mary starts decreasing, the name Paul starts increasing in popularity. 


Show the code
ChristianNames = (df
        .query("name in ['Mary','Martha', 'Peter', 'Paul']")
        .query("year >= 1920 and year <=2000"))

ChristianNames_chart = px.line(ChristianNames, x='year', y='Total', color = 'name', title='Mary, Martha, Peter and Paul Through Time')

ChristianNames_chart.update_layout(xaxis_title='Year', yaxis_title='Total Count', legend_title=' ')

ChristianNames_chart.show()

title: Ana Soto
text:
LinkedIn | Gmail



Power BI & DAX
Microsoft SQL Server
R Studio
Microsoft Excel
Data Visualization
Leadership




Data Analyst     Sept 2021 -  Present
Brigham Young University-Idaho

Developed Power BI and Report builder dashboards/reports for 100+ users
Conducted frequent data analysis using SQL queries
Led and mentored a team of four students in Power BI, SQL and R Studio
Collaborated on report presentation and analysis with a detail oriented team for analyses during a three month period
Performed a word cluster analysis to identify top-rated instructor’s qualities that will influence on 100+ future online instructors’ training

Library Aide     Apr 2021 - Sept 2021
Brigham Young University - Idaho

Developed communication skills through interacting with team members and over 30 patrons per day
Executed various tasks efficiently while maintaining a professional work environment
Provided prompt assistance to library patrons and addressed inquiries




Brigham Young University-Idaho     Expected Graduation July 2024



Database Design and Development Project     Apr 2022 - July 2022
Brigham Young University-Idaho

Designed a comprehensive database with a proper ERD,relationships,keys, and data types
Collaborated within a team to ensure a professional project presentation
Executed various SQL states to populate over eight different tables

title: Client Report - [What’s in a name?]
text:
QUESTION|TASK 4
Think of a unique name from a famous movie. Plot the usage of that name and see how changes line up with the movie release. Does it look like the movie had an effect on usage?
The movie ‘Mission: Impossible’ debuted in 1996 with Tom Cruise being the main actor. The movie had no effect on the popularity of the name in the following years. In fact, we can see that usage of the name started decreasing.However, its most popular year was 1959.


Show the code
Tom= df.query("name == 'Tom'")

Tom_chart = px.line(Tom, x='year', y='Total', title='Tom Through Time')

Tom_chart.add_vline(x='1996', line_dash="dash", line_color="orange")

Tom_chart.update_layout(xaxis_title='Year', yaxis_title='Total Count')

Tom_chart.show()

title: Client Report - [What’s in a name?]
text:
QUESTION 1
How does your name at your birth year compare to its use historically?
The usage of the name Ana was quite popular in the year 1999. My birth year is definetly amongst the three most popular years of its usage. This could definitely explain why I have several cousins whose name is also Ana. The popularity of the name is prominent for about 20 years straight.


Show the code
Ana = df.query("name == 'Ana'")

Ana_chart = px.line(Ana, x='year', y='Total', title='Ana Through Time')

Ana_chart.add_vline(x='1999', line_dash="dash", line_color="orange")

Ana_chart.update_layout(xaxis_title='Year', yaxis_title='Total Count')

Ana_chart.show()

title: Client Report - [What’s in a name?]
text:
QUESTION 2
If you talked to someone named Brittany on the phone, what is your guess of his or her age? What ages would you not guess?
If I was talking to a Brittany on the phone, I would guess her age was between 32 and 34 years old. More specifically, I would guess she is 34 years old. Since, the year 1990 is where the usage of the name is at its highest.


Show the code
Brittany = df.query("name == 'Brittany'")

Brittany_chart = px.bar(Brittany, x='year', y='Total', title='Brittany Through Time')

Brittany_chart.update_layout(xaxis_title='Year', yaxis_title='Total Count')

Brittany_chart.show()

title: Client Report - [What’s in a name?]
text:
QUESTION 3
Mary,Martha,Peter, and Paul are all Christian names. From 1920-2000, compare the name usage of each of the four names. What trends do you notice?
If we take a look at the graph, its quite clear that Mary is the most popular name within the timeframe. The most popular year for the name usage is 1950. In second place, for the most popular name,is Paul. The highest peak for the usage of that name is at about 1954. It is interesting to notice that after the name Mary starts decreasing, the name Paul starts increasing in popularity. 


Show the code
ChristianNames = (df
        .query("name in ['Mary','Martha', 'Peter', 'Paul']")
        .query("year >= 1920 and year <=2000"))

ChristianNames_chart = px.line(ChristianNames, x='year', y='Total', color = 'name', title='Mary, Martha, Peter and Paul Through Time')

ChristianNames_chart.update_layout(xaxis_title='Year', yaxis_title='Total Count', legend_title=' ')

ChristianNames_chart.show()
